description: Dive into "Picture-Perfect Moments in Zermatt" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Picture-Perfect Moments in Zermatt

places.generalDescription: The Gornergrat Railway, also known as the Gornergrat Bahn, is a renowned cogwheel train that ascends the Gornergrat mountain in the Swiss Alps. As Europe's highest open-air rack railway, it offers passengers an enchanting journey through scenic landscapes, tunnels, and bridges. With six stations along its route, the railway provides unparalleled panoramic views of iconic peaks like the Matterhorn and Monte Rosa range.

sources.snippet: The valley station of the Gornergrat Railway is located right opposite the railway station. The dark orange train of the Gornergrat Railway is practically one of the fixtures of the mountain village and a very popular photo subject in itself. The backdrop changes constantly: First, the cog railway winds its way through the village, then it passes the historical Riffelhaus and finally leads up to the Gornergrat at 3,089 m a.s.l.
sources.shortName: Zermatt photo spots - as if made for Instagram

places.name: Gornergrat Railway

reviews.text:
Ideal for any one and everyone, spectacular mountain train journey, Zermatt to the Gornergrat summit. some of the most breathtaking views of the Swiss Alps, including the iconic Matterhorn.

The journey takes around 33 minutes and offers panoramic views of forests, alpine meadows, and glaciers.

The train is clean, comfortable, and offers large panoramic windows for maximum visibility.

At the summit, you get an unobstructed view of the Matterhorn. A half-day visit is ideal, but you can easily spend more time exploring the area.

It was an amazing experience with breathtaking scenery. The seats were comfortable, and the train ride uphill offered beautiful views of the Matterhorn. For the best mountain views while ascending, be sure to sit on the right side of the train.

If you get on the first train It's not crowded. The train was shut down for a few hours after ours.  Those of us on the first train were lucky to had the whole place to ourselves. Gorgeous weather for hiking!

places.generalDescription: Matterhorn is a renowned alpine peak known for its distinctive pyramid shape and challenging climbing routes to the summit. It is part of the TORX program, featuring great trails in the Aosta Valley. Visitors can take a cable car to reach the terrace and enjoy stunning views of Matterhorn, Mont Blanc, Gran Paradiso, Monte Rosa, and Swiss peaks. The area also offers access to Plateau Rosa and Grotta di Ghiaccio on foot.

sources.snippet: The next photo spot is ready and waiting on arrival at the summit: a breathtaking view of the Gorner Glacier and the Matterhorn. Walking the 360¬∞ Loop Gornergrat, an easy 20-minute panoramic hike at the summit, is the best way to savour the scenery. The perfect ‚ÄúHoru‚Äù (Matterhorn) picture is definitely waiting for you here somewhere.
sources.shortName: Zermatt photo spots - as if made for Instagram

sources.snippet: The mighty Matterhorn dominates the skyline, creating one of the most unique alpine landscapes in Europe. Explore the hiking trails, journey up higher into the mountains by cable car and train, stroll the scenic streets of Zermatt, and go skiing all year long. Here are the best things to do in Zermatt.
sources.shortName: 20 Amazing Things to Do in Zermatt, Switzerland

sources.snippet: 1.) Stunning panoramic views of the surrounding Alps, including the Matterhorn, Monte Rosa, and numerous other summits, are available from Gornergrat. The scenery is really stunning and provides a fantastic opportunity for landscape photography.
sources.shortName: Gornergrat & Other Top Photo Spots in Zermatt

sources.snippet: The Matterhorn towers majestically over town and I love the balance of colour at this time in the evening between the lights of town and the blue ambience in the sky as the day fades.
sources.shortName: The Best View in Zermatt, Switzerland - Adventure & Landscape Photographer

sources.snippet: Read on to get inspired by some outstanding Matterhorn photos. They were captured by amazing Instagram photographers and travellers and featured on Instagram @visitswitzerland.
sources.shortName: The best Matterhorn views

places.name: Matterhorn

reviews.text: In my experience it was way better than Jungfrau. My family loved it. You can take the tram to the second to last stop and start walking down along the track for a beautiful view of the lake, the top of the mountain, the valley.

Nature is unbelievable. Matterhorn has around 430K of marked trails, everywhere you look is a beautiful nature. Valleys, glaciers, hills, fields, cows. Had an amazing hike and will be back hopefully sometime. Would love to Mountain bike here too, its just so beautiful and raw.

The Matterhorn is a must-see in Switzerland. Only after the trip did I realize how many different views of the Matterhorn I had captured. It truly is a mountain that draws your eye from every direction. Whether gazing up from the charming town of Zermatt or taking the train for a panoramic view from above, each perspective offered its own unique beauty. Some accommodations in Zermatt offer stunning views of this mountain, perfect for admiring it right from your window. We enjoyed seeing the Matterhorn in the morning, afternoon, and night, and the spectacular view looked breathtaking at every hour.

places.generalDescription: Matterhorn Glacier Paradise is a must-visit destination in the Alps, offering a breathtaking experience. The journey to this highest cable car station in Europe from Zermatt village takes 45 minutes, providing panoramic views of peaks and glaciers. At the top station, visitors can explore a restaurant, shop, cinema, and viewing platform showcasing famous Alpine peaks in France, Italy, and Switzerland.

sources.snippet: Matterhorn Glacier Paradise set at the top of Klein Matterhorn mountain peak, is one of the must-see areas that you absolutely shouldn‚Äôt miss in Zermatt, no matter in which season you visit. At 3,883 m (12,739 ft) above sea level, this is the highest viewing platform in the Alps, with a 360¬∞ panorama of some of the highest mountains in Europe. From the top, you can see 14 Alpine glaciers and 38 mountain peaks higher than 4,000 m (13,123 ft), including Matterhorn just nearby, but also Mont Blanc in the distance.
sources.shortName: 21 TOP Things to Do in Zermatt, Switzerland (+Map & Tips for Your Visit)

sources.snippet: This will be your highest altitude visit in Zermatt (3883m) and simply must be on your things to do in Zermatt Switzerland list. Be prepared to marvel at 16 glaciers and count thirty 4000+ metre peaks in 3 countries.Europe‚Äôs highest cable car station is at Klein Matterhorn and already the ride up there is an adventure not to be missed. You can read our full article here, on how to get to Klein Matterhorn and its Matterhorn Glacier Paradise
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to do in Zermatt ‚Äì For First Time Visitors

sources.snippet: No bucket list of scenic spots in Zermatt would be complete without Klein Matterhorn, the highest peak accessible by aerial tramway. This location serves as the climax of our list, as it‚Äôs the highest point we can reach without climbing the Matterhorn. Why should you visit Klein Matterhorn?
sources.shortName: 10 Viewpoints in Zermatt (Matterhorn Famous & Unique Views)

sources.snippet: You don‚Äôt need any mountaineering skills, ropes or crampons to reach the summit of the Klein Matterhorn. Just step off the Matterhorn Glacier Ride and into the summit lift and up you go. Then you mount a flight of steps, and the summit cross is almost within touching distance.
sources.shortName: Photo points & photo locations Zermatt

sources.snippet: Back in Zermatt, a gondola lift is waiting to take you to your next destination, the ‚ÄúMatterhorn glacier paradise‚Äù. At the ‚ÄúTrockener Steg‚Äù (dry landing stage), you will change to the new and glamorous Crystal Ride.
sources.shortName: Zermatt photo spots - as if made for Instagram

sources.snippet: This is what a real Alpine paradise looks like ‚Äì and the views at 3883 metres above sea level are divine. From the viewing platform you can look out over 38 four-thousanders, 14 glaciers and three countries.
sources.shortName: Summits & mountains around Zermatt

sources.snippet: There are three main mountain peaks to visit from Zermatt: Matterhorn Glacier Paradise, Gornergrat, and Rothorn. Visit all three or pick your favorite. We cover all of these later in this article.
sources.shortName: 20 Amazing Things to Do in Zermatt, Switzerland
How To Find The Best Zermatt Matterhorn Viewpoint (2025)!

places.name: Matterhorn Glacier Paradise

reviews.text:
Visiting Matterhorn Glacier Paradise was one of the most unforgettable highlights of my time in Switzerland, as well as in Zermatt. The journey up, via a series of gondolas, builds anticipation with every stop, and once you reach the top, the panoramic views are absolutely breathtaking. Standing at over 12,700 feet, with snow-covered peaks stretching across Switzerland, France, and Italy, it truly feels like you're on top of the world.

One of the most unique features is the Ice Palace, an ethereal experience where you walk inside a glacier. The cool, quiet tunnels carved into the ice are unlike anything I've seen before, with sculptures and shimmering walls that make the whole experience feel dreamlike.

The combination of the Ice Palace, the observation deck, and the surreal stillness at that altitude created a moment of awe I wasn't expecting. It's more than just a viewpoint; it's a space that invites you to pause, breathe deeply, and feel small in the best possible way. Despite the high elevation, the facilities were incredibly well maintained, and everything felt thoughtfully designed for visitors.

For anyone visiting Zermatt, this isn't just a scenic stop, it's a once-in-a-lifetime experience that stays with you long after you descend.

Matterhorn Glacier Paradise was absolutely amazing. Easy gondola ride up from town, and the views at the top are insane. You're surrounded by glaciers and massive peaks, and you can even spot mountaineers and skiers out on the snowfields. We hiked the Matterhorn Glacier Trail partway down, and the scenery was nonstop. Alpine lakes, rocky terrain, and the Matterhorn in the background the whole way. Easily one of the highlights of our trip to Zermatt.
Very beautiful but weather is risky until the last moment. I bought the tickets months in advance and was lucky to get some great views then also a snowstorm within one hour in end of may.

places.generalDescription: Gornergrat is a rocky ridge in Zermatt, accessible by a cog railway, and renowned for its stunning views of the Matterhorn and the Gorner Glacier. Visitors can opt for luxury hotels like Cervo Zermatt or unique stays at Riffelalp Resort 2222m or Igludorf. For activities, skiing on beautiful slopes and taking the panoramic train to Gornergrat are highly recommended.

sources.snippet: The valley station of the Gornergrat Railway is located right opposite the railway station. The dark orange train of the Gornergrat Railway is practically one of the fixtures of the mountain village and a very popular photo subject in itself. The backdrop changes constantly: First, the cog railway winds its way through the village, then it passes the historical Riffelhaus and finally leads up to the Gornergrat at 3,089 m a.s.l.
sources.shortName: Zermatt photo spots - as if made for Instagram

sources.snippet: Gornergrat is another must-see in Zermatt that every visitor should visit at least once!. It‚Äôs a mountain ridge at 3,089 m (10,132 ft), with stunning views of the Gorner Glacier, Matterhorn, and countless other mountain peaks. Just as Matterhorn Glacier Paradise, Gornergrat is accessible in any season.
sources.shortName: 21 TOP Things to Do in Zermatt, Switzerland (+Map & Tips for Your Visit)

sources.snippet: Gornergrat, a scenic spot in Zermatt, has been Switzerland‚Äôs most visited excursion destination since 1898. This observation deck is perched on a rocky ridge of the Pennine Alps, situated east of the Matterhorn and overlooking the Gorner Glacier to the southeast. Why is Gornergrat a must-visit?
sources.shortName: 10 Viewpoints in Zermatt (Matterhorn Famous & Unique Views)

sources.snippet: The Gornergrat and Matterhorn Glacier Paradise are the most compelling visitor excursions in the Alps. Both peaks can be explored in a single day with the Peak2Peak Pass. A day filled with records.
sources.shortName: Summits & mountains around Zermatt

sources.snippet: There are already many nice ‚ÄúToblerone Mountain‚Äù shots to get inspired ‚Äì from Gornergrat, Zermatt village and also our exclusive little Matterhorn hashtag #visitswitzerland_cantresist on Instagram
sources.shortName: The best Matterhorn views

sources.snippet: Gornergrat is a viewing platform that offers the best views of the Matterhorn, as well as the other peaks in the mountain range. This includes the tallest mountain in Switzerland, Dufourspitze.
sources.shortName: Top 53 Photo Spots at Zermatt in 2024

sources.snippet: From Zermatt station, head past the Gornergrat Bahn station on Getwingstrasse and then turn left towards the Sunnegga funicular entrance.
sources.shortName: How To Find The Best Zermatt Matterhorn Viewpoint (2025)!

sources.snippet: Once you have arrived at the Gornergrat the vista over the Gorner-Galcier and the other glaciers left and right of it is stunning.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to do in Zermatt ‚Äì For First Time Visitors
20 Amazing Things to Do in Zermatt, Switzerland

places.name: Gornergrat

reviews.text:
Gornergrat Viewpoint (3,089m) üèîÔ∏è
‚Ä¢ Half-price with Swiss Travel Pass üéüÔ∏è
‚Ä¢ Train to watch landscapes shift from meadows to glaciers! üåø‚ùÑÔ∏è
‚Ä¢ Aletsch Glacier views + 360¬∞ snowy peaks-nature's masterpiece! ‚ú®

‚ö†Ô∏è Essentials:
‚òëÔ∏è Sunglasses (snow glare!) üï∂Ô∏è
‚òëÔ∏è Warm layers üß•üß§
‚òëÔ∏è Check weather before heading up üå¶Ô∏è

Great views. Trains do get crowded so be prepared to stand for most of the time.
Views are amazing.
Took the train to Gornergrat and hiked down to Riffelberg. Amazing views and experience. July, cool up top, shorts and long sleeves, hiked a couple hours including breaks for pictures and snacks.

places.generalDescription: Kirchbr√ºcke is a popular spot in Zermatt, Switzerland, known for its stunning views of the Matterhorn. The viewing point is being expanded to accommodate more visitors and will soon have a lift installed. Nearby, there's a beautiful church next to a cemetery, making it an ideal evening visit. For the best photos of the mountain, clear sunny days are recommended.

sources.snippet: Our journey begins with Kirchbr√ºcke, a scenic spot in Zermatt that‚Äôs conveniently located in the town center. This bridge serves as a connection between the two halves of Zermatt, divided by the main river of the valley, Matter Vispa. From the vantage point of Kirchbr√ºcke, looking south and perpendicular to the bridge, a picturesque view unfolds.
sources.shortName: 10 Viewpoints in Zermatt (Matterhorn Famous & Unique Views)

sources.snippet: Kirchbr√ºcke is the closest and easiest view of Matterhorn from town is also the most famous one. The small bridge offers stunning views of the mountain. Highly recommended for great sunrise views.
sources.shortName: Best Matterhorn views for shooting photos |

sources.snippet: From this scenic spot, you get a wonderful view of the Matterhorn. The best time to take a photo here is in the morning, before afternoon clouds hide the peak of the Matterhorn.
sources.shortName: 20 Amazing Things to Do in Zermatt, Switzerland
Photo points & photo locations Zermatt

places.name: Kirchbr√ºcke

reviews.text: They say this is the world's most captured mountain & after visiting this place my doubts were cleared as well. We visited zermatt in November and we were lucky to get the clear view of Matterhorn with the beautiful fall season tree Colors. It's mighty Matterhorn.

Almost everywhere in Zermatt, when you look up, you can see the Matterhorn. However, tourists love to flock to Kirchbr√ºcke because the Matterhorn is ‚Äúright in the middle‚Äù. The area can get too crowded for a good picture. Alternatively, at any point along the canal, you can still take pictures of the Matterhorn.
If you can wake up very early, I would suggest going for a morning walk, the surroundings are very tranquil. üëçüëçüëç
On a clear day this would be a super view of the matterhorn. Unfortunately, it was cloudy when I visited but still worth a visit

places.generalDescription: Chez Vrony is a renowned on-mountain restaurant located in the Findeln area of the resort. It offers amazing food and a stunning view of the Matterhorn from its terrace. The family-owned establishment has a long tradition and is accessible by gondola or ski-in from a blue run. The restaurant is known for its warm hospitality, with owners Max and Veronika likely to greet you upon arrival.

sources.snippet: Our favorite restaurant on the mountain is Chez Vrony, and the incredible view of the Matterhorn is part of the reason why!. Sit down and enjoy a hot chocolate or a glass of wine while admiring the Matterhorn. Fun fact: Chez Vrony is also a great place to get ‚Äòreflection in wine glass‚Äô photos of the Matterhorn ‚Äì the ros√® is to die for!
sources.shortName: Zermatt, Switzerland - Best Spots for Photos of the Matterhorn

sources.snippet: On the list are Adler Hitta, Findlerhof, Enzian, and Chez Vrony, a Michelin-starred restaurant. You can choose one and have lunch or spend the afternoon hopping from one restaurant to the next.
sources.shortName: 20 Amazing Things to Do in Zermatt, Switzerland

places.name: Chez Vrony

reviews.text: A very unique experience that requires a hike to get to this restaurant. Set atop a beautiful mountain range, you'll dine overlooking stunning Swiss Alps views. The food was fresh and delicious.

The view and ambience is unmatched! We've traveled a lot and this was truly one of the most stunning views we've ever had while dining. The food was also spectacular! We got the burger and the pasta special, and both were delicious. Cannot recommend enough!

Here's a polished version of your review for Chez Vrony:

‚∏ª

Our experience at Chez Vrony was truly an 11 out of 10. The location is absolutely magical, with the most breathtaking views of the Matterhorn. We went to celebrate my mom's 70th birthday, and the staff went above and beyond to make it special. They were so kind and accommodating-letting our group of four sit at the very front of the patio (a spot that usually only seats two). At the end of lunch, they even surprised my mom with a birthday dessert, which was such a thoughtful gesture and made her day unforgettable. I am so grateful to them for creating such a wonderful memory.

The food was excellent-the salads were fresh, flavorful, and filling, and the cocktails were delicious and refreshing after the hike down. Everything was beautifully presented and tasted just as good as the views looked!

The hike itself was very manageable on the way down, but if you're going with seniors, I'd recommend bringing hiking sticks, as the trek back up can be a bit tough. We had an 11:30 reservation, so the hike down was comfortable, but heading back up later in the day got hot-definitely bring sunscreen.

Between the views, the food, and the warm, thoughtful service, Chez Vrony is absolutely worth the effort to get there. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting Zermatt-it's an experience you'll never forget.

places.generalDescription: Gornergrat is a must-visit destination offering stunning views of the iconic Matterhorn mountain. The Gornergrat Railway, one of the oldest tourist railways, provides a breathtaking journey from Zermatt to this picturesque spot. At the Gornergrat Railway Station, visitors can capture free photos at the Matterhorn Photo Point and enjoy panoramic views of the surrounding Alps.

sources.snippet: If you have not yet been up the Gornergrat it is now time to ride the Gornergrat Bahn. Be prepared for a scenic 33min ride with a vertical climb of 1,469 m. The Gornergrat Bahn is Europe‚Äôs highest open-air cog railway and brings passengers direct from Zermatt to the summit of the Gornergrat at 3135m.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to do in Zermatt ‚Äì For First Time Visitors

sources.snippet: The Gornergrat Bahn is a great way to get to the highest peaks, its bright red colour also looks interesting in photos. There‚Äôs also some great photo opportunities ride. I saw para-gliders several times around town and managed to get this capture out of the train window in the evening light.
sources.shortName: The Best View in Zermatt, Switzerland - Adventure & Landscape Photographer

places.name: Gornergrat

reviews.text: This spot is the last stop on the Gronergart railway. It's way up above the clouds, and no matter when you visit, you'll always get an amazing view of the Matterhorn mountain. To enjoy it even more, it's a great idea to arrive early in the morning. That way, you might have this fantastic place all to yourself and savor the breathtaking view without any rush or crowds.
This is the final stop of the incredible mountain railway that takes you to the Gornergrat summit. The train ride was smooth, and the scenery along the way was truly stunning.

Had great weather, really enjoyed it. We took our time and absorbed. We had lunch with the matterhorn behind us. That's not a picnic you have often!
The train itself was impressive too.
Can't find a fault!

places.generalDescription: Riffelsee is a classic alpine lake located in a picturesque setting, renowned for its crystal-clear waters that beautifully reflect the iconic Matterhorn. This popular spot is easily accessible via the Gornergrat Bahn, a famous cog railway, making it a favored destination for many visitors. Situated at an altitude of 2757 meters, Riffelsee offers stunning photo opportunities of the Matterhorn without requiring extensive hiking. The 1.

sources.snippet: The Riffelsee lake might be more famous than the previous two, but I do not find photos from this lake more appealing. The reason why most of the photos available in different online galleries and stock databases are from here is simple: this place can be easily accessed by a famous cog railway called Gornergrat Bahn. A little nice train takes you higher and closer to the summit compared to the 5-Lake Trail.
sources.shortName: How to Photograph the Matterhorn

sources.snippet: If you are looking for picture-perfect views of the Matterhorn, be sure to visit the mountain lake Riffelsee. When there is no wind, you can see wonderful reflections of Matterhorn in the calm waters of this tiny lake. Together with the Gornergrat Railway, this is one of the most photographed places in Zermatt.
sources.shortName: 21 TOP Things to Do in Zermatt, Switzerland (+Map & Tips for Your Visit)

sources.snippet: Among all the views of Matterhorn reflecting off a small alpine lake probably the one from Riffelsee is my favorite. From here you have one of the best views of the mountain. Differently from Stellisee lake, water stay steady for longer as the small lake is better repaired from any blowing breeze.
sources.shortName: Best Matterhorn views for shooting photos |

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre looking for an epic reflection photo, Riffelsee is the place to be. The stunning lake perfectly reflects the Matterhorn on calm days, and it‚Äôs a lovely walk to take in any case. To get to Riffelsee, hop off the Gornergrat Bahn at Rotenboden and follow path 21.
sources.shortName: Zermatt, Switzerland - Best Spots for Photos of the Matterhorn

sources.snippet: You‚Äôve seen these Matterhorn reflections before if you are on Instagram. Stellisee is one lake on the famous 5-lake walk. Riffelsee is a nice little hike from Riffelalp, and don‚Äôt miss the two smaller lakes just below Riffelsee.
sources.shortName: The best Matterhorn views

sources.snippet: The lake of the Riffelsee (2,757 m) offers the ultimate in mountain tranquillity. The reflection of the Matterhorn on the surface of the water is one of nature‚Äôs finest spectacles.
sources.shortName: Photo points & photo locations Zermatt

sources.snippet: From here, a short walk leads to the famous Lake Riffelsee ‚Äì the ultimate photo spot of Zermatt. No other lake reflects the Matterhorn so beautifully on its smooth surface.
sources.shortName: Zermatt photo spots - as if made for Instagram

sources.snippet: While I may not have the means to stay at the Riffelalp Resort just yet, I‚Äôm all for embracing the thrill of outdoor adventures.
sources.shortName: 10 Viewpoints in Zermatt (Matterhorn Famous & Unique Views)

places.name: Riffelsee

reviews.text:
Really such a breathtaking and beautiful place ü•≤‚ù§Ô∏è. Was blessed with really good weather when I came, with clear blue skies and a perfect view of the Magnificent Matterhorn ü•∞ü•≤‚õ∞Ô∏è , and what more with the reflection of the Matterhorn across the lake ‚ù§Ô∏è.

Truly so pretty and perfect!! Feeling so happy and thankful everytime I look at my pics‚Ä¶. Tons of hikes to do at this area, what more can you ask for really! ü•∞üöÇ
It's not a very difficult walk. There are some stairs, but I think most people could manage. The view is very beautiful, the reflection is very clear, and it's not very crowded.

One cannot understate how incredible the view is here - and especially so with clearer skies.

It is well worth the early-morning journey to avoid the hoards of tourists who arrive closer to midday, etc.

places.generalDescription: Gornergrat, located high above Zermatt in Switzerland, offers breathtaking panoramic views of the surrounding Alps, including iconic peaks like the Matterhorn and Monte Rosa. At nearly 3,100 meters high, this mountain provides an unparalleled vantage point to admire 29 mountains over 4,000 meters. The summit features a hotel and various attractions such as an observatory and a planetarium. Hiking enthusiasts can also explore several trails while capturing stunning landscape photography opportunities along the way.

sources.snippet: 1.) Stunning panoramic views of the surrounding Alps, including the Matterhorn, Monte Rosa, and numerous other summits, are available from Gornergrat. The scenery is really stunning and provides a fantastic opportunity for landscape photography.
sources.shortName: Gornergrat & Other Top Photo Spots in Zermatt

places.name: Gornergrat

reviews.text: A small 5min hike up from the railway station. Do not miss the spot. It give exemplary views of the Matterhorn and the glacier in it's raw form. Amazing! When we can, there was hardly anyone here. Loved it! What a place. You see Helicopters flying around from here.

Very beautiful views of the Gorner Glacier as well as Matterhorn and the other peaks (make sure you check the weather in advance before booking your tickets so you can ensure good views). I recommend coming in the morning since usual around lunch time you have more people and more clouds. We went with the train and then hiked our way down to Riffelalp and it was totally worth it (if you want to make short hike- go down to Riffelsee lake which is excellent spot for a quick lunch and nice photos of Matterhorn)

Beautiful mountains, especially on the train ride. We were promised sheep, but not given any neither on the trails. The trails are very rocky. The little shop near the train station has in fresh croissants and extremely overpriced items.

places.generalDescription: Nestled within the enchanting Five Lakes Walk, Grindjisee is a captivating gem that offers a unique perspective of the iconic Matterhorn. Unlike its larger counterpart Stellisee, this smaller lake is tucked away in a serene valley and surrounded by charming larch trees along its southwest shore. The hike to Grindjisee is relatively easy, with some moderate sections, making it accessible for most adventurers eager to explore Switzerland's breathtaking landscapes.

sources.snippet: The second lake to be admired in the 5 Lakes trail is Grinjisee. Although this lake also reflects the Matterhorn peak on its surface, the location and setting of Grinjisee is very different compared to Stellisee. It is much smaller, it is in a relatively deep valley, and its southwest shore is lined up with nice trees (larches).
sources.shortName: How to Photograph the Matterhorn
Top 53 Photo Spots at Zermatt in 2024

places.name: Grindjisee

reviews.text:
The 5 lakes trail is a nice hike, downhill or uphill, that's up to you.

All along the trail you will be able to admire the Matterhorn / Toblerone.
Beautiful lake during the 5 lakes hike.

A lovely place. One of the five lakes. Water is clear and the trees are reflected in them. A great place to stop and freshen up or have a picnic during the hike! On a clear day you can see the Materhorn in front of you as we did and can see in our photos. Incredible!

Don't forget to have a photo on the large rock! Be careful though!

places.generalDescription: Stellisee is a stunning mountain lake located near Zermatt in the Swiss Alps, known for its clear waters that beautifully reflect the iconic Matterhorn. Surrounded by alpine meadows and majestic peaks, it's a favorite spot for photographers and nature enthusiasts seeking the perfect shot of the mirrored peak. The glacial lake offers a tranquil setting and serves as an ideal location for nature photography.

sources.snippet: If I were to recommend only one location, I would go for the 5-Seenweg (the 5-Lakes Trail) and specifically for Stellisee. Stellisee is a mountain view that offers perfect mirror reflections of the Matterhorn peak located some 15 km (air distance) southwest. Except for afternoon times around 3-6 PM in Summer, the sun is in a very favorable position for good photographs throughout the day.
sources.shortName: How to Photograph the Matterhorn

sources.snippet: This is a shorter walk, just 20 minutes from the top of the Blauherd cable car at 2571m. To get the perfect picture, you‚Äôll need the weather to cooperate, but when it‚Äôs calm, the Stellisee will reward you with a perfect reflection of the Matterhorn. Other variations on the reflection theme can be found from the lakes at Riffelsee, Grindjisee and Leisee.
sources.shortName: The 5 Best Matterhorn Photo Spots in Zermatt

sources.snippet: Hike to the StelliSee, a clear lake that reflects the clouds and the famous mountain peak. Nature photographers can hike along the mountains and valleys around here to capture impressive shots of this rugged part of Europe. Set your camera at a long exposure to capture the stars behind the mountain during the nighttime.
sources.shortName: Top 53 Photo Spots at Zermatt in 2024

sources.snippet: This view has been the subject of numerous advertising posters. In ideal weather conditions, the Matterhorn is impressively reflected in the lake. It gives the impression of an abyss behind the lake, directly in front of the Matterhorn.
sources.shortName: Viewpoints winter

sources.snippet: Stellisee is a charming small lake that offers stunning reflection of Matterhorn at sunrise and in the morning. Beautiful also at sunset. Try to get up there as earlier as possible.
sources.shortName: Best Matterhorn views for shooting photos |
20 Amazing Things to Do in Zermatt, Switzerland

places.name: Stellisee

reviews.text:
I circled this lake as part of my mountain run.
There are no high vegetarian or any trees so you can clearly see the whole lake.
At the east corner there is a point where the Matterhorn is reflected nicely on the water so many people will take pictures there.
The lake is connected to 3 trails: one up to Fluhalp, second up to Blauherd and third down Grindjisee.
Effortless walk. But many big groups of tourists. So it's very crowded. There's some construction going on, but it didn't affect the overall experience too much.

If the weather was clear, then I don't have any lingering attachment about here. But ... at that moment, it was cloudy and sometimes rainy.
I couldn't realize that temperature, so I took a jacket just in case. However during the tracking, I was feeling hot.. so it was just stuff for carrying.

places.generalDescription: The H√§ngebr√ºcke is the longest pedestrian bridge in the Alps, offering a thrilling experience as you walk 85 meters above the Zermatt valley on its 500-meter-long walkway. This suspension bridge spans the Gorner Gorge and provides a magnificent view of Zermatt. The circular route from Furi to the bridge and back takes about an hour, with signposted paths and great scenery. It's important to note that this adventure is only available between May and October.

sources.snippet: The H√§ngebr√ºcke is a hanging suspension bridge located near the Furi cable car. From the bridge you get a nice view of the town of Zermatt.
sources.shortName: 20 Amazing Things to Do in Zermatt, Switzerland

places.name: H√§ngebr√ºcke Furi

reviews.text: Holy cow, the H√§ngebr√ºcke Furi in Zermatt is unreal! The views are insane ‚Äì Matterhorn looming, river crashing below, and those golden trees in fall? Stunning. I'm no fan of heights, but this bridge felt super safe ‚Äì solid steel, barely any sway. It's a quick 15-minute hike from the Furi cable car, totally doable. Switzerland nails it with this one ‚Äì thrilling, gorgeous, and safe as heck. 5 stars, no question!
Easy to reach and spectacular bridge over Gorner gorge. The story of the Gorner glacier that once craved the valley and advanced until 1859 is fascinating, too.
Very fun to walk across bridge, relatively easy trail and cute small park along the way. No Matterhorn view

places.generalDescription: Riffelsee is a stunning high-altitude lake in Switzerland, offering unparalleled views of the iconic Matterhorn. It's a popular spot for visitors to Zermatt, especially during the spring when the first flowers bloom and in autumn with its beautiful orange-yellow hues. The area offers a challenging hike with loose soil but rewards hikers with breathtaking scenery. To avoid crowds, it's recommended to catch the first or second train up and check the weather beforehand for optimal conditions.

sources.snippet: The Riffelsee lake and its Matterhorn reflection cast a spell that draws people from around the world: a viewpoint that is high on the bucket lists of Zermatt visitors. It‚Äôs especially beautiful in spring, when the first flowers appear. Or in autumn with its orange-yellow hues.
sources.shortName: Viewpoints winter

places.name: Riffelsee

reviews.text: Make this your first stop on the way up to Gornergrat!  Beat the wind and see a great reflection on the lake!  Then go up to the top on a subsequent train.  You'll be happy you did!

It's was beautiful and cold and even though we could not make it all the way to the lake and I believe it was snow/frozen over. Words and photos can not describe the scale of how big the mountains are

Absolutely stunning! Woa this is an amazing sight to witness, the mountain reflection on the lake. Donot miss this place! Get down at Rottenboden station and then home down to the lake side. That's the best way to reach here. Photos cannot capture the real pure beauty of the place and the majestic jaw dropping view! If you are lucky you will get a clear day view.

places.generalDescription: Monte Rosa is a 15,203-ft. high mountain offering an advanced rocky and icy hike with stunning views of the Alps. The eastern slope presents the impressive Monte Rosa massif, featuring the "four sisters" peaks: Gnifetti, Zumstein, Dufour, and Nordend. This area also boasts a well-equipped ski resort with slopes suitable for all levels in the Monte Moro and Belvedere areas.

sources.snippet: 1.) Stunning panoramic views of the surrounding Alps, including the Matterhorn, Monte Rosa, and numerous other summits, are available from Gornergrat. The scenery is really stunning and provides a fantastic opportunity for landscape photography.
sources.shortName: Gornergrat & Other Top Photo Spots in Zermatt

places.name: Monte Rosa

reviews.text:
The ascent starts from the monte rosa hut. Breakfast is either at 2 o'clock or 6-7 o'clock. The first 1600 meters ascent are easy, except for a few nasty crevasses. The last part is over the ridge, all the fixed ropes are taken away so the ridge is now AD- (we had lots of mixed terrain). For the last 30 meters you need to topklim and rappel back down. We were back at the hut around 12 o'clock.
Would definitely recommend this mountain
Very beutiful there is the matterhorn roght behind but you don't see it.
Short hike.   About 45 mins round trip.  Easy terrain.  Our baby loved it.   Pack lunch the offerings are a bit sparse

places.generalDescription: The 5 Lakes Walk, also known as the 5-Seenweg or Five Lakes Trail, is a renowned hiking route in Zermatt that showcases the stunning alpine landscape. This trail takes hikers through a former glacial area and offers breathtaking views of the Matterhorn reflected in three of the five beautiful mountain lakes along the way.

sources.snippet: The 5 Lakes hike is often mentioned as one of the best hikes in Zermatt. And indeed, if you are looking for a beautiful hike with some of the best mountain views and a nice variation in Alpine scenery, this is an excellent option. This trail is called ‚Äò5-Seenweg‚Äò (also indicated as hike nr. 11) and you can find it in the Sunnega ‚Äì Rothorn area.
sources.shortName: 21 TOP Things to Do in Zermatt, Switzerland (+Map & Tips for Your Visit)

places.name: 5 Lakes Walk

reviews.text: This trail is approximately 6 miles long. It's a beautiful trail that takes you past 5 different lakes with majestic views of the Matterhorn. It's a relatively easy trail, medium in difficulty. There are restaurants along the way if you don't want to pack a picnic. If you're hiking this with a group, it will take almost all day.
Beautiful hike with Matterhorn in view almost entire time. The lakes were amazing, and swimming in the last one. Was relatively difficult, but doable.

Went to Stellisee then cut to Leisee directly as time was limited and found Stellisee has the best view among the 5 lakes. The hike itself was not difficult, but still takes an afternoon if you're doing all 5.

places.generalDescription: Restaurant Stafelalp is a relatively new addition to the dining scene near Schwarzsee, quickly making its way into the top 10. The hut offers a stunning setting with timber floors and sheepskin furnishings, creating a cozy atmosphere. Specializing in lamb dishes, including historic lamb cutlets and unique variations like Shafer-Pasta, the restaurant provides an exceptional ovine experience below the Matterhorn.

sources.snippet: The imposing north face of the Matterhorn can be captured in both summer (by walking from Schwarzee to Stafel) and in winter (on the piste #52 to Stafelalp). Take some time to chill out on the bench and enjoy the view (and maybe set your camera on timer for a behind-the-bench selfie).
sources.shortName: The 5 Best Matterhorn Photo Spots in Zermatt

places.name: Restaurant Stafelalp

reviews.text: Very cute little mountain hut with amazing food and great service. We liked it so much that we came twice, once by skiing and the next day by hiking up a beautiful trail from Zermatt village.

Every time I come to Zermatt, I make sure to eat at Scht√§felalp. It's a bit off the beaten path, quiet, and offers an incredible view of the north face of the Matterhorn-an angle you don't usually see. The mountain stands right in front of you, absolutely majestic.

The service is spot on, striking the perfect balance between elegance and relaxation. And the food? Simply excellent-authentic, well-executed, and delicious. A fantastic spot to soak in the scenery while enjoying a great meal!
Skied to this great restaurant today and had a fantastic lunch. Quality of ingredients were first class as was the flavour. I can't wait to come back.

places.generalDescription: Klein Matterhorn is a snow-covered peak in the Alps, offering the highest cable car ride in the region and stunning views of the Matterhorn. It is part of the Matterhorn Ski Paradise, which includes three main ski areas: Sunnegga, Gornergrat, and Klein Matterhorn.

sources.snippet: For a different angle of the Matterhorn, head up to Klein Matterhorn. The Klein Matterhorn (little Matterhorn) is at a blustery 12,739.5 feet above sea level, so be aware that you will feel short of breath once you reach the top. When arriving at the top, the doors opened and the cold thin air hits you, immediately chilling you to the bone.
sources.shortName: Zermatt, Switzerland - Best Spots for Photos of the Matterhorn

sources.snippet: Honestly, this was one of my favourite things to do in Zermatt during our two day stay. To physically enter deep inside a glacier (15 metres) at nearly 4000m altitude, left me in awe. And the whole Palace does not disappoint.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to do in Zermatt ‚Äì For First Time Visitors

places.name: Klein Matterhorn

reviews.text: Admiring the beautiful mountains above the white clouds, although a little cold, it feels like being in heaven. My soul is instantly cleansed, and I feel the insignificance of human beings and the magnificence of nature.

I'm not sure why Gornergrat gets all the attention when the trip to Klein Matterhorn is both slightly cheaper and offers a much more unique experience. If I could have only done one it would definitely have been this one.

At 3,883 m, this is the highest you can get in Europe by cable car - higher than even Jungfraujoch. The journey itself has some nice views as you go up and down from station to station. As you near the top, passing over an astonishing glacier, the air gets thin and I noticed myself getting tired just walking up a slope! But it is so worth it.

Walk down a few steps and you can step out on to the Breithornplateau, 3.8 km high, and walk on snow and ice, even in the middle of August. And of course enjoy the view of the Matterhorn, but also nearby Breithorn, which you can climb if you're feeling fit. On a clear day like when I visited, you can even see Mount Blanc 70 km away on the horizon.

You can even walk across the snowy plateau to Italy if you like. There is a real sense of the icy expanse.

As a bonus the ice caves within the glacier are a really neat experience. The ice sculptures are cool (literally) and you really get a sense of wonder at the sheer amount of ice all around you, slowly sliding down the mountain.

Definitely worth it.

Great experience at the top of the Klein Matterhorn in Zermatt, Switzerland. Three cable cars to reach the top. Apart from the amazing views, there is also the opportunity to walk through a crevice in the glacier. Climbing to 12700 feet was definitely a wonderful experience.

places.generalDescription: Rotenboden offers a variety of activities for visitors, making it an ideal destination for both skiers and non-skiers. Accessible via the Gornergrat train from Riffelberg, Rotenboden is home to the famous Riffelsee, which provides stunning photography opportunities as it begins to thaw in late spring. For those looking for alternative winter activities, there are prepared snow trails for leisurely walks and long sled runs exceeding 1 km in length.

sources.snippet: On the way back down into the valley, you shouldn‚Äôt miss a stopover at the station Rotenboden. From here, a short walk leads to the famous Lake Riffelsee ‚Äì the ultimate photo spot of Zermatt. No other lake reflects the Matterhorn so beautifully on its smooth surface.
sources.shortName: Zermatt photo spots - as if made for Instagram

places.name: Rotenboden

reviews.text: this is the stop to get off if you want to see Matterhorn's reflect on lake Riffelsee. My suggestion is to get off at this stop when you are coming back down. The lake is a short walk from the station. It is off trail though. If the condition is windy then you might not be able to see the reflection.
Remembering the place where my friend almost lost his life
Love..love..love...nice view..

places.generalDescription: Trockener Steg is a 9,642-ft. mountain in Zermatt, Switzerland, offering skiing and a cable car ride. It also features a discovery center with a VR experience. The area has several lift stations including the Sunnegga lift station restaurant, Trockener Steg, and Riffelberg. Visitors can enjoy basic lunches at relatively modest prices at these stations.

sources.snippet: At an altitude of 2939 metres, different worlds come together. The realm of eternal ice fuses with rocky terrain and moraines. Trockener Steg is the pivotal point, with a view of Europe‚Äôs highest mountain station, from the Matterhorn down to Zermatt.
sources.shortName: Summits & mountains around Zermatt
Zermatt photo spots - as if made for Instagram

places.name: Trockener Steg

reviews.text: Great place for skiing, been there in May, buying ski tickets in advance in that time period is something that I cannot recommend , because of weather that is changing quite fast and because of that ski lifts do not operate quite often. It is safer to buy tickets on the day of skiing.
The Matterhorn feels like so close from here, nice view on the sunny day

There for hikers: you get the best view of the divine Matterhorn all along your semi challenging journey from Trockener Steg to Schwarsee. Absolutely stunning and good level of work out. Attention however that you will need proper hiking shoes to avoid slippery snow-covered path.

places.generalDescription: Zermatt Matterhorn Viewpoint at bridge, also known as Kirchbrucke, is a beloved spot in the village offering a direct and stunning view of the Matterhorn. From this vantage point, visitors can take in the majestic sight of the Mattervispa river below and the surrounding larch trees. To reach this viewpoint, one can walk from Bahnhofstrasse, passing by the church and museum before arriving at the bridge.

sources.snippet: The Kirchbr√ºcke is one of the best known and loved viewpoints in the village. The outlook from the bridge provides a direct view of the Matterhorn, including the Mattervispa river below and surrounding larch trees. How to get there: Walk from Bahnhofstrasse - pass the church and the museum and continue to the next bridge.
sources.shortName: Viewpoints winter

places.name: Zermatt Matterhorn Viewpoint at bridge

reviews.text: Stunning and amazing backdrop, what a nice place overall this is. Clean clear and pristine waters flowing by. Absolutely enjoyed this
Good viewing spot but unfortunately the fog covered the view of Matterhorn today!
Has beautiful view of the matterhorn. You can also sit here with the nice view and drinking water fountain.

places.generalDescription: The Edelweissweg H√∂hbalmen is a stunning hiking trail in Zermatt, Switzerland that offers breathtaking views of the iconic Matterhorn. This trail is perfect for nature lovers and photographers, as it is filled with beautiful meadows and the national symbol, edelweiss flowers. The hike to Hohbalmen is best enjoyed in the summer when the meadows are at their most beautiful.

sources.snippet: The Edelweiss path in Zermatt passes through several scenic points and charming hamlets. Among these beautiful spots are Arbenbachfall and H√∂hbalmen. Why should you visit H√∂hbalmen?
sources.shortName: 10 Viewpoints in Zermatt (Matterhorn Famous & Unique Views)
Photo points & photo locations Zermatt

places.name: Edelweissweg H√∂hbalmen

reviews.text: Visited Zermatt for a long weekend and spent good part of a day hiking from Zermatt through Zmuttgletscher and on to near the base of the Matterhorn. Some magnificent views of the iconic Matterhorn along the way. Bring some water, but there are also several opportunities for some fresh ice melt or spring water. Once past Zmuttgletscher the trail is mostly flat (periodic slight grade). Further you go better the views. Even with some snow at higher elevations not much of a problem hiking through. One of my favorite hikes in Europe.

Totally worth going. you will see the north face of Matterhorn is its full power. Magnificiernt and unforgotable path. Aster ca. 10km of walk upwards you can eighter turn left towards the Bridges where you can fellow the Pathfinder back along the stream or you can go up to Schwarzsee. pleas consider also going on up to the Schoebielhuette at altitude 2694 above sea level. from Schoenbielhutte mu must go back the same way. Great experience in Zermatt

An absolut must for hikers visiting Zermatt.
Not difficult but strenuous. Pack a lunch, water, and extra cloths.
We hiked up via Edelweiss and Trift all the way to the back and returned via Zmutt. Definitely an all day hike. The views are absolutely fantastic.

places.generalDescription: Zermatt Sign is a popular tourist spot located near the Schwarzsee cable car station, offering a picturesque view of the Matterhorn in the backdrop. The sign itself is just a short walk from the cable car stop and provides an excellent photo opportunity for visitors. Despite occasional crowds, it's generally not overcrowded, allowing for a peaceful experience with stunning views. The area also features Schwarzsee, a small mountain lake that attracts many visitors during the summer months.

sources.snippet: If you are looking for some nice and easily accessible places in the mountains around Zermatt, be sure to stop at Schwarzsee on your way to/from Matterhorn Glacier Paradise. This is one of the cable car stations that you pass anyway, and since it‚Äôs included in your ticket and doesn‚Äôt take much time, it‚Äôs well worth a quick visit. Schwarzsee ( black lake) is a small mountain lake that is very popular in summer.
sources.shortName: 21 TOP Things to Do in Zermatt, Switzerland (+Map & Tips for Your Visit)

places.name: Zermatt Sign

reviews.text: They changed the sign recently to these new blue letters which look amazing with the background of the stunning Matterhorn. A favorite place for great photos and a little break with an incredible view.
A short walk from the station you can get a great photo with the Matterhorn behind
The short walk from the gondola to the sign isn't bad at all! Just make sure you have decent boots/shoes! Nice and sunny up there!

places.generalDescription: The Matterhorn Glacier Trail is a popular choice for families and tourists seeking a more relaxed hiking experience while still enjoying the beauty of the Matterhorn. With just 150m of total incline, it's considered one of the easier hikes in Zermatt. The trail offers stunning views of the imposing Matterhorn and surrounding glacier landscapes, providing an immersive experience into the world of glaciers.

sources.snippet: There are countless hiking trails in Zermatt, and it‚Äôs really difficult to choose which one is worth your time the most, especially if you only have a few days here. One of the most special hikes with the most unique scenery is probably Matterhorn Glacier Trail. If you are looking to do just one longer and a bit more challenging hike in Zermatt, make it this one.
sources.shortName: 21 TOP Things to Do in Zermatt, Switzerland (+Map & Tips for Your Visit)

places.name: Matterhorn Glacier Trail

reviews.text: One of the better hiking trails in the area. Go on when the visibility is super clear as the entire point is hiking against a clear view of the Matterhorn. Doing this downhill it's not only easier but offers the better views.  Highly recommended.  This is doable with children that are probably 8 or above as the terrain requires decent amount of concentration to avoid slipping.

A beautiful route at an altitude of over 2,500 metres where you can see the beauty of the High Alps and can almost touch the Matterhorn. On the route you can also see places where glaciers were present in the past, but also see the impact of the greenhouse effect on the earth. The route is not technically difficult. There are a few fairly steep climbs with minor ascents. The route can be covered in 2h45min without hurrying.

We started at Trockener Steg and descended to Schwarzsee. It took us about 4 hours, including photo and meal stops. It was one of the most beautiful hiking experiences ever! One gets it all: lakes, snow, peaks, glacier, rivers, colored stones, up and down paths, bare rocks to green grass.
